class_notes:
This course examines the development of abilities such as thinking and reasoning. There is also an emphasis on how children learn to use spatial skills, numerical representations, memory, and language. The focus is on how scientific theory and principles can inform our understanding of these abilities.


Prior completion of PSYC 110, or PSYC 111, or AP/IB credit in psychology.
course_description: Examines the development of abilities such as thinking, reasoning, learning, remembering, language, spatial skills, categorization, and counting.
schedule_location: TTh 10am-11:15am in New Psyc Bldg 230 (36 Eagle Ro
